website_summaries.verdict: This is a classic grill for a few very good reasons.
pros: Cooks great, looks great, and it lasts forever
Stands out for its sturdy construction and its easy assembly
This grill is noted for its superior heat distribution control
cons: Lacks an ash collector under the kettle
Can get a bit tippy when loaded up with charcoal

customer_reviews.title: I could easily feed a family of 8 with this
customer_reviews.text: Gave this to my husband for his Birthday... he is still thanking me for this purchase. Now we BBQ every weekend!~ It's quite big btw. I could easily feed a family of 8 with this.
customer_reviews.author: Janina Fajardo

customer_reviews.title: Improved Again
customer_reviews.text: At least the third Kettle that we have owned - each an improvement over the previous model. Recent improvements include a better system for securing the legs; better hand grips; and generally a sturdier build. There is not a better charcoal grill available.
customer_reviews.author: James B

customer_reviews.title: My husband loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this grill for my husband for Father's Day and he LOVES it! I didn't realize there was much of a difference between charcoal grills, but when our cheap $30 grill needed to be replaced after 6 years, I decided to give the Weber a shot. My husband loves the ease of emptying the ashes and says the heat is more evenly distributed than with his other charcoal grill. I have also noticed that the Weber infuses more of the charcoal flavor into the food, which we love.
customer_reviews.author: Regan

customer_reviews.title: Defective Grill
customer_reviews.text: Product delivered was defective. I could install the “Bowl Handle Assembly” because the mount is crooked. I’m attaching a picture and would ask for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: A. Wong

customer_reviews.title: Grill master
customer_reviews.text: Great grill. Just a tip the leg pins probably wont go in but does not hinder assembly just dont get frustrated lol it's worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Shawna Parton

customer_reviews.title: Great for our small family.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband. We went to Home Depot to look at grills where he insisted that Weber was the best and he liked that you can turn the coals from the bottom. I wasn't convinced so we held off to do 'research'. By research I just mean looking at Amazon reviews. Sure enough husband was right, Weber is the best value for money. So far so good, I just wish I'd purchased a grill cover with it. The 22 inch is a good size for our family of two.
customer_reviews.author: rootielu

customer_reviews.title: Built Well
customer_reviews.text: Years ago, I used Weber. Then I didn't grill for a very, very long time. When I came back to it, I bought a small, table top grill. After going through three of them, because they just wouldn't last, I finally bought this Weber. I expected it to be tough to put together because I remember the one I had years ago. So I was pleasantly surprised to see how easy it was. It was well built and the assembly was dummy proof, which is what I needed. Now, I even have family members coming over when I grill so they can add something. It has made a difference, and also brought back fond memories.
customer_reviews.author: PdD Girl

customer_reviews.title: Heard great things about Weber, can’t believe them apparently.
customer_reviews.text: Ended up missing the screw needed to assemble the handle on the bottom half, the top half has about an inch to and inch and a half where it has been bent and looks like grinder down to where all the paint is gone. Had to spend a half hour measuring and bending the lid as well as the rim on the bottom half to where the lid would actually close like it’s supposed to. Not happy at all. Box had the normal minor dings from shipping but no holes and nothing to explain all this.
customer_reviews.author: J. B.

customer_reviews.title: Best and cheapest grill I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: My fancy gas grill finally died so I bought this $100 Weber to bide some time till I figured out what I wanted next. That was 8 years ago. This thing is just awesome. Worried about time to get coals going? Buy a chimney and you're all set. Takes 15 minutes which is about the time a gas grill needs to heat up. Food tastes better and this thing is well built! I don't own a cover and its out in the rain and elements with zero rust. Now I have to replace the grate every other year but no biggie. My advice, but it you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B. Boese

customer_reviews.title: Possible knock-off Weber Grill
customer_reviews.text: Entry port-locks to hold the legs onto the grill are not aligned and locks for the wheels won’t cling onto the metal. First time I have ever had an issue with Weber purchased on Amazon, I don’t think this is a real Weber grill.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: My 1st Weber
customer_reviews.text: Well known for excellent grills, I decided to get a Weber since it was a great deal and only a few more dollars then less rated no name grills. My grandson (12) and I put it together yesterday and it is just too pretty to grill in lol. I haven't used it yet but I have no doubt that it will be excellent. The Weber is what my dad used when we were little and last year us kids bought him a new one....finally. This will probably be the last pit I need to purchase. Great seller also, super fast delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible assembly instructions!
customer_reviews.text: Assembly is not the easiest and there are no verbal instructions, just illustrations....very poor instruction. I am 67 years old with hand arthritis and now wish I had not ordered this unassembled. I will look for another brand that is already assembled.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon1928

customer_reviews.title: my 2nd Weber
customer_reviews.text: My first Weber lasted 25 years without a cover and out in the elements. I got a cover for this one. Seems like it might be a little thinner metal although I imagine it will last longer than I will...
customer_reviews.author: Robert Chandler

customer_reviews.title: Grill looks good, but is very flimsy: look elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: Flimsy, flimsy, flimsy! Grill looks good from a distance, but the metal is very thin in the body, and in the lid as well as the grilling surface. Pulling it on all but the smoothest surfaces rattles the lid right off: it’s not very stable. Assembly was fairly easy, but the wordless, pictures only, manual could be ambiguous. Bottom line, the grill will probably grill stuff ok, but I don’t expect that it will last very long
customer_reviews.author: W. Gaboda

customer_reviews.title: Great charcoal grill
customer_reviews.text: Had same Weber at lake house where legs corroded and broke after approx 30 years. The last 17 it sat in the weather, so I expect this one to last at least the same. Did get Weber cover to protect this one so it’ll last longer! Easy to assemble, great directions. Only thing I’d change is attaching wheels is with clip thru axle hole rather than tap on cap. But same design on original lasted 30 yrs so should be ok.
customer_reviews.author: mano

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time just buy a Weber
customer_reviews.text: So yeah. This grill is as great as everyone says it is. Easy to assemble. Easy to clean. Well made. I removed the easy clean assembly from the bottom as I always use this with the vents completely open. Makes cleanup even easier. Not sure how long this grill will last me but I will definitely be buying another Weber when the time comes. I've already bought a few upgrades for my Weber. - Vortex mini. Saves charcoal and allows easy indirect cooking. - Hunsaker carbon steel griddle plate. Smash burgers!!!! - Weber 8835 gourmet cooking grate. Perfect for use with the Vortex mini.
customer_reviews.author: Ticklemecisco

customer_reviews.title: Ready to grill .  Looks Great.  Easy intuitive assembly.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Good Price. On time delivery. Easy to assemble, instructions are pictures which are very informative, suggest careful study of picture on cover of instruction book dated 10/16/18 . Extra items included: one wheel cap and a small tool to hand tighten the handle. Glade they included these. Ash cleaning lever clears all 3 vents at once. Con: I wish it had a second handle in order to lift the grill up for adjusting it into the wind for better heating. Will have to jockey this model around.
customer_reviews.author: LouietheToad

customer_reviews.title: Quality gone down.
customer_reviews.text: The wheel assembly and stand have substantially lowered in quality since the last tome I bought a Weber grill. The wheel hub design is cheap and not very durable. If you attach the caps at the wrong angle you will need to replace them. Older designs did not use these crappy caps and were easy to replace pins. Not recommending a Weber grill ever again. I’d i wanted a cheap Chinese-made charcoal grill I would have bought the 50 dollar ones.
customer_reviews.author: E. T.

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I can smoke a rack of ribs on it with a couple bricks or make a pile of burgers and dogs you just cant beat the best.
customer_reviews.author: kevin

customer_reviews.title: Problems with Assembly, But It Works!
customer_reviews.text: This was a HUGE pain to put together, with parts not quite matching up and the instructions being different from what we received. I nearly sliced my hand trying to get the metal pieces connected! That said, now that it's together, it's easy to move around and does exactly what it's supposed to do, so there's not much else to say!
customer_reviews.author: Cat LadyTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: A great starter grill
customer_reviews.text: I got my Weber about a month or two ago and have used it twice. I really like how well the vents can control the temperature and it's held up well so far. My only suggestions is that if you're considering this grill get the one with the ash drum component at the bottom. The tray still catches it, but it's a pain to have to take it off the grill without getting ash everywhere. Also, if/when I get another one i'll probably opt for the premium version with the temp gauge and the side table. Overall it's a pretty good product.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Bull

customer_reviews.title: Didn't know what i was doing before this.
customer_reviews.text: I am not a griller. Like at all. I had a gas grill and i think i broke it. I decided i needed to simplify my life and i wanted to grill so bad over the summer so i bough this. I am a fan of charcoal now for life. I watched some youtube videos on how to use this grill and how to grill certain foods. I grilled burgers on this and they were amazing. I bought this one over the more pricey new one because its not necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Shopaholic1

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I previously had a Weber grill for about 10 years. I did replace several parts, but I loved it. It was getting old, so my family decided to get me this new one for my birthday. What a disappointment. First the ash pan was missing so I had to contact Weber to send me one. They were very nice and I got it in about a week. However the quality of the grill is terrible. Cheaply made legs that don’t even begin to fit correctly, and the lid is out of line and does not snug up. If this grill lasts a year I will be amazed.
customer_reviews.author: karen robinson

customer_reviews.title: It sliced my thumb open on day one
customer_reviews.text: I barely bumped the lid against my thumb when I was dragging it back into my shed, and it just laid my thumb open. I had to use my other hand to catch the blood so I didn't stain my deck on the way back to the house for medical attention. VERY sharp edge. Also, the lid is extremely poor fitting. It's a super inexpensive grill, so this is one of those times where you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Wordwrkr

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality grill
customer_reviews.text: Love this Weber charcoal grill! Not cheap metal grill but much nicer and good value. Arrived as promised and works well for cooking 4-6 burgers for my small family stuck at home due to “China” virus. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Moxie one

customer_reviews.title: Heart of the BBQ world
customer_reviews.text: My new Weber kettle is only the 3rd I have had in over 40 years. This one should stand up for the rest of my bbq life. The kettle is a workhorse. We use it at home and when we are rving. It breaks down nicely to travel with, store and use. I also love the fact that I can keep the fire under control to smoke salmon, ribs, brisket, etc. These bbqs are made tough and stand the test of time, even if left out in winter.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Costanich

customer_reviews.title: Assembly is not included
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product at beginning of July. I scheduled assembly appointment 4 times(one I had reschedule), I gave up at end of July. Every time there were excuses on why the scheduled time couldn’t be met. I’m obviously returning it. If you can’t offer assembly, don’t offer the service.
customer_reviews.author: Jm

customer_reviews.title: Weber earns its reputation
customer_reviews.text: This is arguably a bit pricey for what it is, as you certainly pay for the Weber name. But, it does a great job for what it is designed to do. We bought the indirect grilling baskets at a local hardware store and cooked the Thanksgiving turkey in 1 1/2 hours! Also did a pork loin via indirect heating. So, it is more than a grill. Perhaps not for the extreme value folks but not a bad investment....
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good For It's Size
customer_reviews.text: This seems well made and durable. This is a temporary grill, we recently moved and had to leave behind the built in grill at our old home. Since some remodeling needs to be done outside this works perfect for now. I hope to be using it for a bit, but it is good for it's size and seems to cook just fine. Worth what we paid.
customer_reviews.author: R. Kramer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Grill for Newbies
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I bought this as our first grill. We did do some research beforehand but were able to get the grill up and running and it did its job! I would recommend using a chimney to light the coals, buying some nice grilling tools, and buying a cover to accompany this grill. I am glad we got it and we have had a wonderful time using it so far!
customer_reviews.author: Kate Howard

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This grill is a tank. Super easy to put together an it is thick metal an all around nice. I highly recommend this grill. Well worth the money. I bought the cheaper one because I put a stainless steel bowl on the ash tray so it would be easier to dump the ashes an i have a thermometer with two probes. Again... This grill is awesome!!!
customer_reviews.author: Chris cribb

customer_reviews.title: Love My Weber
customer_reviews.text: Using Propane for the last 5 years, am hungry for good tasting food on the grill and bought this Weber... Is Wonderful Weber Wonderful
customer_reviews.author: mary mhed

customer_reviews.title: Third Weber Grill I've Purchased :)
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd Weber grill. The first one was too big, so I gave it to a friend with a larger family and bought myself a smaller one of the same model. It is perfect! I liked it so much, I purchased one for my dad for father's day. They love it, too! Easy to use, easy to clean, just the right size for 2 people. The damper on top gives you some control over the heat. Keep it covered in the winter or during a rainstorm to extend the life.
customer_reviews.author: Lan

customer_reviews.title: good quality and flavor
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for a friend who couldn't be bothered with propane tanks for his propane barbecue. He uses it for all his parties. Usual excellent Weber quality. My brother also uses a similar Weber instead of his propane barbecue--likes the convenience and the flavor better.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Assembly difficult for middle age female
customer_reviews.text: I went to the Bilt app assuming assembly would be easier. It left out a step ... so did I. The legs were extremely difficult to push in. Was my first time cooking on a charcoal grill and the food was amazing. The step that was eliminated doesn't change the performance of the grill but the bottom support thing between the legs hangs to the ground. I should of used the paper instructions that came with it but they were just pictures so I thought the 3 d app would simplify assembly.
customer_reviews.author: ANGELA

customer_reviews.title: My first charcoal grill!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first charcoal grill and I am happy. Charcoal provides a more even intense heat than propane with a better flavor. Why did I use propane for so long? Propane is the microwave of grilling due to its fast setup. Charcoal does take time to get going but when there is cold beer on hand who cares. Fire, beer, redmeat, the smell of burning charcoal, what could be better?
customer_reviews.author: Warren E. Street

customer_reviews.title: Really good grill
customer_reviews.text: It's the Weber Original 22 inch grill. It's easy to control the temperature, so I can grill burgers, steaks, chicken, and I smoked a chuck roast with it. I also purchased the Adrenaline Barbecue Company's Slow and Sear, which was a big help to smoke the chuck roast. I also smoked a couple of ribeye steaks, smoked them forabout 35 minutes and reverse seared them, and they turned out great! Everything has turned out great so far. I am very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Smith

customer_reviews.title: Never had a chance to assemble as top kettle was severly dented
customer_reviews.text: I have an issue with UPS delivering items that have been clearly thrown around. The Weber box was severely beaten and torn as if catapulted against the back of a truck. If UPS don't like working for Amazon then find a company that does. The Weber grill is fine but have to buy a new one due to the negligence of the shipper.
customer_reviews.author: MMT

customer_reviews.title: Grilling great
customer_reviews.text: We have not had a grill for a couple years, we had gas before and my husband wanted to switch to charcoal. It was easy to put together, just follow the instructions. Also follow the instructions for how many cubes to put in, we have been buying the Weber charcoal as well. The food has been great. We would suggest this grill, it is also a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Betsy

customer_reviews.title: Didn't get the free assembly
customer_reviews.text: Can't really say how I like rthis grill, it was supposed to come with free assembly but after two tries I was told that was not possible. I gave 5 stars because I've had Weber products in the past and have always been happy.Had I known I couldn't get the assembly I would have purchased locally with the assembly. I guess my BBQ season is over for this year.
customer_reviews.author: Bonjovi girl

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly simple!
customer_reviews.text: Just bought this for my small deck. Had a bbq with my kids and it was perfect! We cooked chicken, corn on the cob and potatoes and it had the most delicious smokey bbq taste! You don't get that so much with a gas grill. Glad I went with this one instead of the more expensive Weber. Perfect for my family of 5! Also was a breeze to assemble. Took maybe 20 minutes tops! 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Holly Petersen

customer_reviews.title: This grill is awesome.
customer_reviews.text: It had been over a decade since I'd had a grill, and I wanted to start with something simple. This Weber has been awesome. I grilled with it almost every weekend last summer with no problems. It was easy to assemble. I read the reviews here before buying it and I coated the grill to prevent rust, which has worked so far. It's also been durable. I'm looking forward to warmer weekends so I can start grilling again.
customer_reviews.author: Woody

customer_reviews.title: My husband's christmas gift
customer_reviews.text: So I got this for my husband for Christmas, because he had been looking at it for such a long time! It was a surprise he didnt see coming. And he loves it! This review is from what i heard him say, that he loves it. He loves the taste of charcoal on his burger and this one did it!
customer_reviews.author: Mags

customer_reviews.title: Grate on grill is already falling apart!
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed. Weber's are great grills but it's already falling apart after 2 grills.
customer_reviews.author: Breona

customer_reviews.title: The One and Only Kettle
customer_reviews.text: Best kettle out there at a reasonable price...it's my 4th in 40 years! I BBQ alot with coals--not gas---If one follows Weber cooking tips food will be tip-top every time. As well I suggest starting fire w/Weber Chimney--fool proof.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Cooks good on high heat, but lid doesn't seal.
customer_reviews.text: The lid does not make a seal with the base. It leaks, rendering the throttle useless. Only works at full throttle (which, TBF, is most grilling. It does burgers and steaks just fine).
customer_reviews.author: Jaydee

customer_reviews.title: Does the job very well.
customer_reviews.text: I've used it about 3 times though I purchased it a while ago. All three times, it did the job just as it is supposed to. And my grilled meat and veggies tasted to die for. I am so happy I didn't succumb to the masses of my friends' and family's choice and buy a gas grill. Yes the clean up for the charcoal grill is a bit of work, but really not the end of the world.
customer_reviews.author: Tewodaj Mogues

customer_reviews.title: get a Weber its the best!
customer_reviews.text: FINALLY GOT MY WEBER YAHOO! and it was not hard to put together at all it took me 30 minutes and I have a broken finger! I have been wanting a weber grill forever but they cost so much that no one would buy one for me so I had to do it for myself and when I found it on Amazon for 99.00 I had to go for it and I have not cook nothing in the house for the last 2 weeks, get a Weber its the best!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy W.

customer_reviews.title: Gas grills ate for losers! Use a Weber
customer_reviews.text: It is a Weber kettle! Love these grills. They last a long time and food tasted much better that on an expensive gas grill. It was a deal!
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: The Classic Charcoal Grill
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble Easy to clean Sturdy Can grill just a couple of steaks using half the grill or a full family dinner on the whole grill Air inlet/outlet This is your no-frills charcoal grill. It's a classic that has found its way into many American backyards. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: DmanGTR

customer_reviews.title: Great grill
customer_reviews.text: It was a really good grill and Webers are the best
customer_reviews.author: Romel

customer_reviews.title: Be sure it's round
customer_reviews.text: I've worn out my share of Webers. I was excited to get this 22"er going. The top was out of round which I found hard to believe!
customer_reviews.author: Birdman

customer_reviews.title: Love the grill and got a decent price thru Amazon.
customer_reviews.text: Had an old Webber coal grill and loved it until it finally rusted out. This new one is the same and possibly built even better. Can’t go wrong with a Weber! It also came in mint condition and easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Carter

customer_reviews.title: Weber is the best. Trust me and just skip the rest....for gas as well as charcoal grills!
customer_reviews.text: Nothing to say here except after owning a dozen gas grills over the past 20 years, there is absolutely NO ONE who can beat Weber for quality, design, and performance. Buy the charcoal starter and this becomes effortless grilling. I have a gas Weber too....love them both.
customer_reviews.author: HLLW

customer_reviews.title: No need for an expensive grill if you know how to cook.
customer_reviews.text: Everyone I talk to say Big Green Egg/Primo/Komodo grills reign supreme, but they simple don't know how to cook. I can make as good a steak on this Weber grill. There's no need to heat it to 800 degrees or use special charcoal. Paired with a chimney style charcoal starter, this grill can handle all of your needs. It has a large cooking surface, adjustable vents on the lid and below the coals a tray to catch ashes, wheels, etc. The lid hooks onto the side of the grill, which is convenient when your other hand is full.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Best grill on the market.  Recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Got the Weber, Slow-n-Sear and drip pan. My grilling skills are getting better. Have 40 years of grilling, but this is a game changer. Meats are tensor, juicy and never over done. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Biker Larry

customer_reviews.title: The only way to cook with charcoal.......
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Weber quality, this kettle paired with the Char-Basket Charcoal Holders and the Only Fire Rotisserie Ring Kit for a Weber kettle is the best set up for rotisserie chicken, pork loin, whatever you can put on the spit. Awesome cooking, easy set up, cleanup is easy, it will make the best food you have ever eaten, BAR NONE. I highly recommend buying.
customer_reviews.author: HalibutZach

customer_reviews.title: only 28 inches high
customer_reviews.text: The cooking surface is only 28 inches high, my kitchen stove top is 35 inches high. I am 6 ft 2 so this is a short grill for me. Other than that its great.
customer_reviews.author: Dale R. Bowcott

customer_reviews.title: Positive Addition To Staying Home & Safe.
customer_reviews.text: One of only a few positives during this pandemic. I turned the duties and the cooking over to my grandkids. They are turning into great cooks. You can't go wrong with a Weber.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Romo

customer_reviews.title: It does the job.
customer_reviews.text: It does the job. This is the third one I have. It is a decent cost-benefit purchase. It lasts about 10-15 years before rusting and metal fatigue start, resulting in holes in the body. I never cover them. Just keep them outdoor all the times.
customer_reviews.author: thelittlebluehouse

customer_reviews.title: Huge grill
customer_reviews.text: When i purchased it, i thought it was not that big, i thought that it was one of the small ones. But when i took it out the box, i was surprised to see this huge grill. I dont have to worry about not being able to cook a lot of stuff at once. Everything fits!
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: It’s good. Buy it.
customer_reviews.text: I don’t get paid to write this. I do however love to grill. My dad still has his grill like this one at home. It’s 30 years old. That’s why I bought this one. It was easy to assemble and grills everything from steak to chicken and even biscuits to perfection. If you need a simple and easy to use grill, buy this. Facts.
customer_reviews.author: Nothern Salt Sailor

customer_reviews.title: Best Grill I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd Weber Grill. I've enjoyed grilling on a Weber for many years. It cooks distributes heat and food evenly. You can even use it as a smoker. There are many accessories you can buy for the Weber
customer_reviews.author: Will Hamel

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny
customer_reviews.text: You cannot beat Weber for the quality and performance. This is a grill you can do it all with. I cook directly over coals and indirectly. Have done everything from whole chickens to burgers. One of my favorites is chicken breasts indirectly cooked. Tender and juicy.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Kramer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent grill, what can be said other than it is a Weber.
customer_reviews.text: You can't go wrong with a Weber. I have had all of the cheap grills, they don't last as long, not as well made and just don't seem to produce the Weber quality of taste. I would recommend, though, keeping this guy in a covered area or at least have a cover to put on it when not using it. By doing this myself, I expect this grill to last 10+ years as all of my friends' Weber grills have.
customer_reviews.author: TTkk1

customer_reviews.title: The best grill on the Market
customer_reviews.text: Had a Weber for years and it was damaged by accident. This one has a lot of little improvements from the last one and works great. Free Shipping with Prime! Delivered right to the house. Set up in minutes and we were grilling outside! Great Value.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Grace

customer_reviews.title: It just keeps going and going.
customer_reviews.text: The classic never dies. My gass grill rusted out so I was looking for something reliable that will get the job done for the time being. Through countless cookouts, and regular meals this thing has held up. Incredible value for $100. I purchased a smoking tube and traegar hickory pellets so it also functions as a smoker. You're able to offer the top to allow for more airflow while smoking meat too. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Blair

customer_reviews.title: WEBBE 22" GRILL OUTSTANDING
customer_reviews.text: Best Charcoal Grill that we have ever purchased. Works well and looks good with cover. Would buy another if we could use two grills.
customer_reviews.author: John Shideler

customer_reviews.title: Old School-Classic BBQ Grill
customer_reviews.text: My old Weber Kettle died after 38 years of use. I had replaced almost all the parts except the kettle itself, but finally gave up on replacing parts again (another story). The new grill was easy to assemble and looks to be just about as well-made as the old one. I like the handle guard on the top, designed to protect your hand when you lift off the top. They did take away one side handle (from the 1970s version), but all in all, this one looks like it will last the rest of my lifetime. It is definitely for old-school grilling, and works well to make great-tasting food. Gas is more convenient, but there's no comparison for taste.
customer_reviews.author: Bluebirder

customer_reviews.title: Weber 741001 Silver One-touch 22 1/2 inch Kettle Grill
customer_reviews.text: This little grill works fine for me and a guest....Not big enough to cook for a patio party unless just burgers or hotdogs. Love that it doesn't take much charcoal and it takes very little time to get ready to use. I love charcoal grilled flavor! Gas and electric grills just don't make the food taste as good to me. Not super strong or heavy and the lid doesn't fit well after dropped or blown off one time...The portability of it is a big plus-moving it from one side of patio to the other when ready to cook etc, is easily managed by one person (Just take the lid off first!)
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Cat NC

customer_reviews.title: impossible to attach the legs
customer_reviews.text: I cannot use it until I attach the legs. I tried to attach the push pin legs but it doesnt attach at all. the grill itself is good quality but legs are cheap. there is a video how to assemble but they put another grill's assembly video for this grill. not happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Love bbq
customer_reviews.text: I’m new at grilling and this beauty is great! I wish I had paid attention to the size as I’m only grilling for myself and this thing is huge! Because of that, I don’t use it as often as I would want to but I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Great grill
customer_reviews.text: There is a reason these have a 10 year warranty built to last and you can grill, smoke, basically whatever you want on them. Great piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Alan Wooldridge

customer_reviews.title: Old reliable plus hand don't burn
customer_reviews.text: Yay! Replaced our 30 (40?) year old rusted out one and we are so happy to have it reincarnated! The heat shield on the handle is a great addition. With the old one my hand used to get hot holding the lid and I had to hold it with an oven mit. Not anymore. Otherwise, same exact product. Love it. Why would anyone want a gas grill anyway?
customer_reviews.author: 50-ish couple

customer_reviews.title: Weber Grill
customer_reviews.text: My grill is dented in two places, packaging looked fine but grill looks like it was tweaked a little. I am going to keep it because I don't want to send it back and wait for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great, but store it well, and watch out for black flakes on your food!
customer_reviews.text: Best charcoal bbq around, but make sure you keep it covered or store it indoors. I've left mine out in the rain far too often, and now the lid handle has rusted off (this is after three years, though). As well, there appears to be a black coating on the underside of the lid that started cracking and peeling after about a year. Sometimes, little flakes of the stuff would fall into the food while it was grilling. Not pleasant. But for the money? I'd buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Third Plebeian

customer_reviews.title: Great ... except for the grate.
customer_reviews.text: Overall, the Weber Original is excellent... except for the Plated-Steel Cooking Grate, which is junk. I have since replaced it withwhich is a match made in grilling heaven.
customer_reviews.author: Marshall

customer_reviews.title: We love Weber grills and imitations don't compare.
customer_reviews.text: We love Weber grills and imitations don't compare. Purchase this grill to replace a smaller Smokey Joe Weber grill as we seem to be having more people over and grilling. Very easy to put together. The ground is very uneven where we are in Maine, but a few flat rocks under the none-wheel leg solved the issue. Also due to rough terrain (tree roots, rocks, etc.), it is hard to pull to empty, but it is light enough to carry to empty. But for the most part, it just sits where we set it up!
customer_reviews.author: A. Christian

customer_reviews.title: quality of cooking
customer_reviews.text: really like the weber grill. First one. Cooks great. Easy to clean. Cools quickly. Did not exactly meet the descriptions.
customer_reviews.author: needles

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful little classic!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this grill with a gift certificate I’d had. I had been wanting to buy a simple charcoal grill for quite some time; this Weber is exactly what I was looking for. It was very easy to assemble. I had the whole thing put together in about 20 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok
customer_reviews.text: As with anything today. Cheaper quality product. It’s OK I was hoping a little bit more on the legs from Weber
customer_reviews.author: GaryCalvert

customer_reviews.title: Loved this WEBER
customer_reviews.text: Have bought high priced grills in my life time ,decided to buy a small one ,this Weber is the best grill I ever bought grill all time now
customer_reviews.author: Monica McNeill

customer_reviews.title: Made our summer great!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect grill for beginners and those who love to grill outside with ease and consistent good results! Thank you ~
customer_reviews.author: bluesky

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful new shiny BBQ.
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for the Weber we've owned for 15 years. It finally wore out and it's so nice to have one that the lid seals tight and everything is bright, clean and shiny. We love Weber products.
customer_reviews.author: Karen R.

customer_reviews.title: Great grill!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son at Christmas. The fact that it came with free assembly was awesome! He’s used it for over a month now and loves the grill!
customer_reviews.author: C. Rath

customer_reviews.title: Rolls Royce of Grills
customer_reviews.text: This was a early birthday gift for my son. He loved it and it made our 4th of July a celebration with BBQ food
customer_reviews.author: annapolian

customer_reviews.title: Ash Shelf Tip
customer_reviews.text: I had this grill for over 12 years and recently bought a replacement. I have been very pleased and don't need to reiterate what others have said. What I do want to point out though, is my solution to the substandard ash catcher. I purchased a standard 10 quart galvanized pail from the local hardware store to replace the catcher. You can adjust the clips on the legs such that the rim of the pail fits snugly between. I can go 20 grillings before I have to empty the pail. Another tip... when you are done grilling, close the top and bottom vents and you will have charcoal left for the next time.
customer_reviews.author: tommy t

customer_reviews.title: Great fathers day gift.
customer_reviews.text: I boughtvthis for my husband for fathers day and he absolutely loves it. I've had a grilled meal at least once every 2 weeks and have not heard any complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Marivett Gonzales

customer_reviews.title: solid offering
customer_reviews.text: Well made and does a great job and easy to clean. Bought it for my son and he loves it. It's a Weber!!
customer_reviews.author: Gadget Lover

customer_reviews.title: HEY IT'S A WEBER!
customer_reviews.text: There's not much more to say, I've owned 3 of these in my life , and the only reason I still don't own the 1st is because 2 had to be left behind after overseas assignments. I did get the chance to visit them , and the guys were still using them!! :-) You just can't kill a Weber , take it and any other grill and leave them outside for a year.I'll guarantee when you roll them in the other brand will be a rusted out piece of junk. The WEBER? It'll look brand new, that's just the way Weber makes their products!
customer_reviews.author: Robert W Brown

customer_reviews.title: Replaced one I bought in 1981
customer_reviews.text: Bottom finally rusted out of my old one. New one looks to be of a slightly lesser gauge of steel, we shall see.
customer_reviews.author: Lynne

customer_reviews.title: Love my Weber(s)
customer_reviews.text: Excellent grill very wide grilling area to hold lots ... I use combo of wood and charcoal and prefer the taste and ease of use compared to propane! Especially when hubby out of town. (Not comfortable with using gas always think it's gonna blow up lol) highly recommend as I also have smaller version I use for tailgating and camping etc... That has lasted for years! Highly recommend!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sammy

customer_reviews.title: Love the brand the size and the price!!!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my husband as a Father's Day gift he loves using it and it works just great.
customer_reviews.author: Cori D.

customer_reviews.title: Hot Stuff
customer_reviews.text: Love It like I always have loved this design. It will be with me for a while. Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.author: Jinksed

customer_reviews.title: Great Grill.
customer_reviews.text: Always wanted a Weber. I finally bit the bullet and glad I did. Smoked a turkey for Thanksgiving. Easy to use and clean up. Everyone raved about the turkey. Looking forward to many years of uses, fun cooking and.good food. Don’t wait as long as I did. Buy a Weber.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Typical Weber quality
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and good quality. There are only two of us now so we can cook an entire meal on this grill. I do wish the cookin surface was adjustable however
customer_reviews.author: chad h.

customer_reviews.title: Worth the purchase. Easy to build.
customer_reviews.text: Delivered fast in single box. Easy to put together. About twenty minutes. Holds a ton of coal, lump coal and hickory. Did not get five as bottom flu gets jammed up in hot coals and they fall through a little bigger than expected. Always used charcoal grills and this is just something to note. Drum is good quality. Overall worth the price. Can hold a good amount of food at once too. Legs and wheels are not the greatest material but you get your money's worth. Exterior rain cover is separate.
customer_reviews.author: AG

customer_reviews.title: Lovely Grill
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful Weber Grill! It’s sturdy and it can grill quite a bit of food. Easy to assemble took @ 20 minutes. Fast delivery!
customer_reviews.author: Suzy

customer_reviews.title: Love the weber kettle.
customer_reviews.text: Love this. Our old one was damaged in a storm. This one is of equal quality.
customer_reviews.author: jeanjlj

customer_reviews.title: Daily Usage
customer_reviews.text: Weber brand is always high quality. Since I've purchased this I have grilled hundreds of times and it still looks brand new. I am extremely happy with the purchase and someday if this ever needs replacing I will definitely buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

product_meta.title: Weber 741001 Original Kettle 22-Inch Charcoal Grill
product_meta.description: Stay true to the modern version of the kettle that started it all—the Original Kettle, invented by Weber’s founder, and loved around the world. Its ultra-durable, porcelain-enameled lid and bowl retain heat, while the damperseasily adjust for precise temperature control. With a One-Touch cleaning system for easy cleanup after a long day of grilling, the Original Kettle will always be the grill built for everyone
feature_bullets: Stay true to the modern version of the kettle that started it all—the Original Kettle, invented by Weber’s founder, and loved around the world. Its ultra-durable, porcelain-enameled lid and bowl retain heat, while the damperseasily adjust for precise temperature control. With a One-Touch cleaning system for easy cleanup after a long day of grilling, the Original Kettle will always be the grill built for everyone
Holds up to 13 burgers made with a Weber burger press
One-Touch cleaning system provides hassle-free ash cleanup.Removable, aluminum ash catcher
Porcelain-enameled lid and bowl Retain heat, and won’t rust or peel
Use the lid hook to avoid placing the lid on the ground while grilling
Dampers allow you to easily control the temperature inside your grill
3D interactive assembly instructions for this product are available through the free BILT app.
